de.mrapp.android.dialog.adapter

Class ViewPagerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.view.PagerAdapter
      • android.support.v4.app.FragmentPagerAdapter
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.adapter.ViewPagerAdapter

  • public class ViewPagerAdapter
extends android.support.v4.app.FragmentPagerAdapter
    An adapter, which allows to manage the fragments of a view pager.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class android.support.v4.view.PagerAdapter

        POSITION_NONE, POSITION_UNCHANGED

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewPagerAdapter

        public ViewPagerAdapter(@NonNull
                        android.content.Context context,
                        @NonNull
                        android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fragmentManager,
                        @NonNull
                        java.util.List<ViewPagerItem> items)
        Creates a new adapter, which allows to manage the fragments of a view pager.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the adapter, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        fragmentManager - The fragment manager, which should be used by the adapter, as an instance of the class FragmentManager. The fragment manager may not be null
        items - A list, which contains the adapter's items, as an instance of the type List. The list may not be null

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public final void addItem(@Nullable
                          java.lang.CharSequence title,
                          @NonNull
                          java.lang.Class<? extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment> fragmentClass,
                          @Nullable
                          android.os.Bundle arguments)
        Adds a new fragment to the adapter.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the fragment, which should be added, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no title should be set
        fragmentClass - The class of the fragment, which should be added, as an instance of the class Class. The class may not be null
        arguments - A bundle, which should be passed to the fragment, when it is shown, as an instance of the class Bundle or null, if no arguments should be passed to the fragment

      • removeItem

        public final void removeItem(int index)
        Removes the fragment at a specific index from the adapter.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the fragment, which should be removed, as an value

      • clear

        public final void clear()
        Removes all fragments from the adapter.
